1. Friction opposes the relative motion between the two surfaces in contact.
  2. Friction depends on the nature of surfaces in contact.
  3. Friction can be broadly classified into :
    • Static friction
    • Sliding friction
    • Rolling friction
  4. Friction is important for some activities, whereas in certain cases it is undesirable.
  5. Friction can be controlled depending on our requirements.
